intro: Crocanthemum canadense, commonly known as Canadian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, fields, and roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its yellow to orange flower heads bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, with a distinctive grayish-green color that helps distinguish it from similar species.
